items.label: Teaching–Learning Facilities
items.content: Air-conditioned lecture theatres with audio-visual aids and live procedure broadcasts, Largest tertiary care hospital with attached super-specialty centre.

items.label: Teaching Learning Methodologies
items.content: Dedicated AETCOM sessions, Structured self-directed learning (SSDL) modules, Flipped classrooms, Integrated modules, Family Adoption Program, Induction programs, Get Set Go, PG training facilities including advanced modular OTs, Skill training sessions. Teachers training programme for capacity building by Medical Education Unit and NMC Nodal Centre for Faculty development.

items.label: Technology-Enabled Digital Learning
items.content: LMS with resource sharing, quizzes, assignments.

items.label: Laboratory & Hospital Facilities
items.content: Histology, Haematology, Histopathology, Biochemistry, Microbiology labs, OSPE/OSCE ward for skill training & assessment, CRL with high-end equipment and integrated research.

items.label: Advanced Teaching, Museum & Skilllab
items.content: “Jigyasa” digital museum (15,000+ sq. ft.), QR-coded, self-learning hub, “Anukriti” Simulation Centre with high-fidelity mannequins, AHA & National Board accreditation, Mayo Clinic-backed Standardized Patient Program (SPP), Cadaveric skill lab with soft-embalmed specimens, Wet lab for basic to advanced surgical skills.

items.label: Library Facilities
items.content: Fully air-conditioned central resource, Books, journals for all departments, Subscriptions: Access Medicine, UpToDate, Royal Society of Medicine, BMJ, Digital library with 100+ computers and Wi-Fi.

data.title: Mahatma Gandhi Ayurved College, Hospital, and Research Centre (MGACH & RC)
data.tagline: Blending Ancient Wisdom with Modern Evidence
intro_paragraphs: Ranked 6th Nationwide, Grade “A” by MARBISM for National Commission for Indian System of Medicine, Ministry of AYUSH, Govt. of India.

Founded in 2007 to honour Mahatma Gandhi’s ideals of self-care, ethical healing, and community service, MGACH&RC, Salod (H), Wardha, blends Ayurveda wisdom with real-world practice. Students gain hands-on learning in a NABH-accredited 372 beded hospital...
more_paragraphs: Research at this center is actively pursued through national and international collaborations...

programs.name: BAMS (Bachelor of Ayurvedic Medicine and Surgery)

data.heading: Mahatma Gandhi Ayurveda Hospital
paragraphs: The 372-bed, NABH-accredited first Ayurveda hospital in Central India is committed to delivering exceptional care...
Specialty OPDs cover a wide range of disciplines including ENT, eye care, detoxification...
Traditional Kriya Kalpa therapies such as Aschotana and Tarpan support natural healing...

data.heading: DEAN’S MESSAGE
paragraphs: Jawaharlal Nehru Medical College & Acharya Vinoba Bhave Rural Hospital, established in 1990 under the Datta Meghe Institute of Higher Education and Research (Deemed to be University), Wardha, stands as a premier institution for medical education, research, and healthcare services. Ranked 23rd nationally, we offer MBBS (250 seats), postgraduate, super-specialty, paramedical, and PhD programs, all accredited with NAAC ‘A++’.

Our innovations include ‘Anukruti’, a state-of-the-art Simulation Centre, ‘Jigyasa’, a central integrated museum, and early adoption of NEP 2020. As a nodal centre for faculty development, we integrate cutting-edge teaching methodologies and host national and international conferences. Through robust community partnerships, we adopt villages to extend healthcare services.

We are home to the region’s largest tertiary care hospital, a Super-specialty centre, and a dedicated Cancer hospital, offering a comprehensive range of services, including robotic surgery, oncology, cardiology, nephrology, neurology, neurosurgery, urology, gastroenterology, interventional radiology, and transplant facilities. With a strong focus on research and quality education, we remain dedicated to innovation and compassionate healthcare and community well-being.

data.heading: MEDICAL EDUCATION UNIT, JNMC, WARDHA
paragraphs: The Medical Education Unit (MEU) at Jawaharlal Nehru Medical College, Wardha, is the in-house body of faculty representatives from Pre-Clinical, Para-Clinical and Clinical subjects, who plays a pivotal role in ensuring the quality of medical education by focusing on implementation, monitoring and evaluation of faculty training, curriculum revision, development of learning resource material, innovation in instructional tools and assessment.

The MEU aims to equip medical educators with advanced teaching methodologies and pedagogical skills, ensuring the delivery of effective and contemporary medical education, a standardized approach to medical education across institutions and continuous improvement of educational practices and policies within the institution.

data.title: STEP INTO THE WORLD OF EVIDENCE-DRIVEN, COMPETENCY-BASED LEARNING.
intro_paragraphs: Founded in 1990 and recognized as a Deemed-to-be-University in 2005, DMIHER is a dynamic hub of multidisciplinary learning. With exceptional faculty, state-of-the-art facilities, and an industry-aligned curriculum, it fuels innovation, research, and a vibrant campus life— shaping future leaders ready to make an impact.

data.title: A Legacy of Excellence. A Vision for the Future.
data.intro: The Datta Meghe Institute of Higher Education and Research (DMIHER), formerly Datta Meghe Institute of Medical Sciences (DMIMS), is an institution on a dynamic growth path. Recognized as a Deemed University by the University Grants Commission (UGC) in 2005, DMIHER has expanded beyond its foundational roots in medical education, emerging as a thriving center for multidisciplinary learning.

pillars.title: Integrated
pillars.desc: Sharing, Nesting, Co-relation, Integrated, Museum SISA, IDCD

pillars.title: Self-directed
pillars.desc: Structured SDL, PBL, mPBL, Flipped classrooms, Student portfolios

pillars.title: Technology Driven
pillars.desc: Simulations, Standardised LRMs, LMS, E-portfolios, e-Learning resources, MOOCs – RSM, Coursera, SWAYAM

pillars.title: Patient Centric
pillars.desc: ECE, Student clerkship method of clinical training, Evidence based journal club

pillars.title: Community/ Industry Oriented
pillars.desc: Comprehensive health care program, Industry integrated programs

vision.title: Vision
vision.content_mobile: To emerge as the global centre of excellence in the best evidence based higher education encompassing a quality centric, innovative and interdisciplinary approach, generating refutative research and offering effective and affordable health care for the benefit of mankind
content_desktop: To emerge as the global centre of
excellence in the best evidence based
and offering effective and affordable health
care for the benefit of the mankind

mission.title: Mission
points: DMIHER shall develop competent, confident, concerned, compassionate and globally relevant professionals by quality, learner, community and evidence centric ‘competency-based model’ of higher education with a value orientation, through all its constituent units.
It shall foster a conducive milieu for interdisciplinary research practices generating consequential and meaningful outcomes for the nation in general and the region in particular.
It shall deliver comprehensive quality health care services to the rural, needy, marginalized and underprivileged populace.
This shall be achieved through appropriate collaborative linkages and a proactive, transparent and accountable decentralized governance system.

values.title: Purpose-Driven Excellence
values.description: We pursue excellence with clarity of purpose—grounded in evidence, inspired by impact.

values.title: Compassion with Competence
values.description: We nurture professionals who blend knowledge with empathy, serving humanity with heart and skill.

values.title: Integrity in Innovation
values.description: We lead with curiosity and act with conscience—ensuring our innovations uphold ethics and elevate society.

values.title: Collaboration for Impact
values.description: We break silos and build bridges—across disciplines, communities, and borders—to multiply our contribution.

values.title: Equity in Access and Action
values.description: We believe progress must be inclusive. From rural healthcare to global research, we act where we are needed most.

data.ctaText: Click on the buttons below to explore more about our facilities and student welfare initiatives.

timeline.content: Registered under Bombay Public Trust Act, Reg. No. 1260 (N), dated 17.06.1988.
Jawaharlal Nehru Medical College established — the foundation of DMIHER’s legacy in medical education.
Sharad Pawar Dental College established, expanding into dental sciences.
Declared a Deemed to be University by Ministry of HRD, Govt. of India (Notification No. F.9-48.2004-U.3, dated 24th May 2005).
Completed NAAC 1st Cycle Accreditation. Mahatma Gandhi Ayurvedic College added as a constituent unit.
Further expansion with SRMMCON Nursing College and Ravi Nair Physiotherapy College.
Awarded ‘A’ Grade by Ministry of HRD. Completed NAAC 2nd Cycle Accreditation.
Achieved NAAC 3rd Cycle with A+ Grade and CGPA of 3.53/4. Allied Health Sciences College established.
Datta Meghe College of Pharmacy added to strengthen pharmaceutical research.
Datta Meghe Medical College established as an off-campus center.
FEAT Engineering College launched. Centre for Distance and Online Education established.
Achieved NAAC 4th Cycle A++ Accreditation with CGPA 3.78/4 — highest among Health Science Universities in India.
Started Shalinitai Meghe Homeopathy Hospital College and Research Centre.
